trans-unit.source: Manage Azure Backup vaults and servers | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage Azure Backup vaults and servers | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use this tutorial to learn how to manage Azure Backup vaults and servers.
trans-unit.target: Use this tutorial to learn how to manage Azure Backup vaults and servers.

trans-unit.source: Manage Azure Backup vaults and servers
trans-unit.target: Manage Azure Backup vaults and servers

trans-unit.source: In this article you'll find an overview of the backup management tasks available through the management portal and the Microsoft Azure Backup agent.
trans-unit.target: In this article you'll find an overview of the backup management tasks available through the management portal and the Microsoft Azure Backup agent.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This article provides the procedures for working in the classic deployment model.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This article provides the procedures for working in the classic deployment model.

trans-unit.source: Management portal tasks
trans-unit.target: Management portal tasks

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: Click **Recovery Services**, then click the name of backup vault to view the Quick Start page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Recovery Services**, then click the name of backup vault to view the Quick Start page.

trans-unit.source: Manage Azure Backup tabs
trans-unit.target: Manage Azure Backup tabs

trans-unit.source: By selecting the options at the top of the Quick Start page, you can see the available management tasks.
trans-unit.target: By selecting the options at the top of the Quick Start page, you can see the available management tasks.

trans-unit.source: Manage Azure Backup tabs
trans-unit.target: Manage Azure Backup tabs

trans-unit.source: Dashboard
trans-unit.target: Dashboard

trans-unit.source: Select **Dashboard** to see the usage overview for the server.
trans-unit.target: Select **Dashboard** to see the usage overview for the server.

trans-unit.source: The **usage overview** includes:
trans-unit.target: The **usage overview** includes:

trans-unit.source: The number of Windows Servers registered to cloud
trans-unit.target: The number of Windows Servers registered to cloud

trans-unit.source: The number of Azure virtual machines protected in cloud
trans-unit.target: The number of Azure virtual machines protected in cloud

trans-unit.source: The total storage consumed in Azure
trans-unit.target: The total storage consumed in Azure

trans-unit.source: The status of recent jobs
trans-unit.target: The status of recent jobs

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the Dashboard you can perform the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the Dashboard you can perform the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: **Manage certificate** - If a certificate was used to register the server, then use this to update the certificate.
trans-unit.target: **Manage certificate** - If a certificate was used to register the server, then use this to update the certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are using vault credentials, do not use **Manage certificate**.
trans-unit.target: If you are using vault credentials, do not use **Manage certificate**.

trans-unit.source: **Delete** - Deletes the current backup vault.
trans-unit.target: **Delete** - Deletes the current backup vault.

trans-unit.source: If a backup vault is no longer being used, you can delete it to free up storage space.
trans-unit.target: If a backup vault is no longer being used, you can delete it to free up storage space.

trans-unit.source: **Delete** is only enabled after all registered servers have been deleted from the vault.
trans-unit.target: **Delete** is only enabled after all registered servers have been deleted from the vault.

trans-unit.source: Backup dashboard tasks
trans-unit.target: Backup dashboard tasks

trans-unit.source: Registered items
trans-unit.target: Registered items

trans-unit.source: Select **Registered Items** to view the names of the servers that are registered to this vault.
trans-unit.target: Select **Registered Items** to view the names of the servers that are registered to this vault.

trans-unit.source: Registered items
trans-unit.target: Registered items

trans-unit.source: The **Type** filter defaults to Azure Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: The **Type** filter defaults to Azure Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: To view the names of the servers that are registered to this vault, select **Windows server** from the drop down menu.
trans-unit.target: To view the names of the servers that are registered to this vault, select **Windows server** from the drop down menu.

trans-unit.source: From here you can perform the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: From here you can perform the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: **Allow Re-registration** - When this option is selected for a server you can use the **Registration Wizard** in the on-premises Microsoft Azure Backup agent to register the server with the backup vault a second time.
trans-unit.target: **Allow Re-registration** - When this option is selected for a server you can use the **Registration Wizard** in the on-premises Microsoft Azure Backup agent to register the server with the backup vault a second time.

trans-unit.source: You might need to re-register due to an error in the certificate or if a server had to be rebuilt.
trans-unit.target: You might need to re-register due to an error in the certificate or if a server had to be rebuilt.

trans-unit.source: **Delete** - Deletes a server from the backup vault.
trans-unit.target: **Delete** - Deletes a server from the backup vault.

trans-unit.source: All of the stored data associated with the server is deleted immediately.
trans-unit.target: All of the stored data associated with the server is deleted immediately.

trans-unit.source: Registered items
trans-unit.target: Registered items

trans-unit.source: Protected items
trans-unit.target: Protected items

trans-unit.source: Select **Protected Items** to view the items that have been backed up from the servers.
trans-unit.target: Select **Protected Items** to view the items that have been backed up from the servers.

trans-unit.source: Protected items
trans-unit.target: Protected items

trans-unit.source: Configure
trans-unit.target: Configure

trans-unit.source: From the **Configure** tab you can select the appropriate storage redundancy option.
trans-unit.target: From the **Configure** tab you can select the appropriate storage redundancy option.

trans-unit.source: The best time to select the storage redundancy option is right after creating a vault and before any machines are registered to it.
trans-unit.target: The best time to select the storage redundancy option is right after creating a vault and before any machines are registered to it.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] Once an item has been registered to the vault, the storage redundancy option is locked and cannot be modified.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] Once an item has been registered to the vault, the storage redundancy option is locked and cannot be modified.

trans-unit.source: Configure
trans-unit.target: Configure

trans-unit.source: See this article for more information about [storage redundancy](../storage/storage-redundancy.md).
trans-unit.target: See this article for more information about [storage redundancy](../storage/storage-redundancy.md).

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Backup agent tasks
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Backup agent tasks

trans-unit.source: Console
trans-unit.target: Console

trans-unit.source: Open the **Microsoft Azure Backup agent** (you can find it by searching your machine for *Microsoft Azure Backup*).
trans-unit.target: Open the **Microsoft Azure Backup agent** (you can find it by searching your machine for *Microsoft Azure Backup*).

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: From the **Actions** available at the right of the backup agent console you can perform the following management tasks:
trans-unit.target: From the **Actions** available at the right of the backup agent console you can perform the following management tasks:

trans-unit.source: Register Server
trans-unit.target: Register Server

trans-unit.source: Schedule Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule Backup

trans-unit.source: Back Up now
trans-unit.target: Back Up now

trans-unit.source: Change Properties
trans-unit.target: Change Properties

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Backup agent console actions
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Backup agent console actions

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To **Recover Data**, see [Restore files to a Windows server or Windows client machine](backup-azure-restore-windows-server.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To **Recover Data**, see [Restore files to a Windows server or Windows client machine](backup-azure-restore-windows-server.md).

trans-unit.source: Modify an existing backup
trans-unit.target: Modify an existing backup

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure Backup agent click **Schedule Backup**.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure Backup agent click **Schedule Backup**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: In the **Schedule Backup Wizard** leave the **Make changes to backup items or times** option selected and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Schedule Backup Wizard** leave the **Make changes to backup items or times** option selected and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: If you want to add or change items, on the **Select Items to Backup** screen click **Add Items**.
trans-unit.target: If you want to add or change items, on the **Select Items to Backup** screen click **Add Items**.

trans-unit.source: You can also set **Exclusion Settings** from this page in the wizard.
trans-unit.target: You can also set **Exclusion Settings** from this page in the wizard.

trans-unit.source: If you want to exclude files or file types read the procedure for adding [exclusion settings](#exclusion-settings).
trans-unit.target: If you want to exclude files or file types read the procedure for adding [exclusion settings](#exclusion-settings).

trans-unit.source: Select the files and folders you want to back up and click **Okay**.
trans-unit.target: Select the files and folders you want to back up and click **Okay**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: Specify the **backup schedule** and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Specify the **backup schedule** and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: You can schedule daily (at a maximum of 3 times per day) or weekly backups.
trans-unit.target: You can schedule daily (at a maximum of 3 times per day) or weekly backups.

trans-unit.source: Items for Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Items for Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Specifying the backup schedule is explained in detail in this [article](backup-azure-backup-cloud-as-tape.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Specifying the backup schedule is explained in detail in this [article](backup-azure-backup-cloud-as-tape.md).

trans-unit.source: Select the **Retention Policy** for the backup copy and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Retention Policy** for the backup copy and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Items for Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Items for Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: On the **Confirmation** screen review the information and click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Confirmation** screen review the information and click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: Once the wizard finishes creating the **backup schedule**, click **Close**.
trans-unit.target: Once the wizard finishes creating the **backup schedule**, click **Close**.

trans-unit.source: After modifying protection, you can confirm that backups are triggering correctly by going to the **Jobs** tab and confirming that changes are reflected in the backup jobs.
trans-unit.target: After modifying protection, you can confirm that backups are triggering correctly by going to the **Jobs** tab and confirming that changes are reflected in the backup jobs.

trans-unit.source: Enable Network Throttling
trans-unit.target: Enable Network Throttling

trans-unit.source: The Azure Backup agent provides a Throttling tab which allows you to control how network bandwidth is used during data transfer.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Backup agent provides a Throttling tab which allows you to control how network bandwidth is used during data transfer.

trans-unit.source: This control can be helpful if you need to back up data during work hours but do not want the backup process to interfere with other internet traffic.
trans-unit.target: This control can be helpful if you need to back up data during work hours but do not want the backup process to interfere with other internet traffic.

trans-unit.source: Throttling of data transfer applies to back up and restore activities.
trans-unit.target: Throttling of data transfer applies to back up and restore activities.

trans-unit.source: To enable throttling:
trans-unit.target: To enable throttling:

trans-unit.source: In the **Backup agent**, click **Change Properties**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Backup agent**, click **Change Properties**.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Enable internet bandwidth usage throttling for backup operations** checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Enable internet bandwidth usage throttling for backup operations** checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Network throttling
trans-unit.target: Network throttling

trans-unit.source: Once you have enabled throttling, specify the allowed bandwidth for backup data transfer during **Work hours** and **Non-work hours**.
trans-unit.target: Once you have enabled throttling, specify the allowed bandwidth for backup data transfer during **Work hours** and **Non-work hours**.

trans-unit.source: The bandwidth values begin at 512 kilobytes per second (Kbps) and can go up to 1023 megabytes per second (Mbps).
trans-unit.target: The bandwidth values begin at 512 kilobytes per second (Kbps) and can go up to 1023 megabytes per second (Mbps).

trans-unit.source: You can also designate the start and finish for **Work hours**, and which days of the week are considered Work days.
trans-unit.target: You can also designate the start and finish for **Work hours**, and which days of the week are considered Work days.

trans-unit.source: The time outside of the designated Work hours is considered to be non-work hours.
trans-unit.target: The time outside of the designated Work hours is considered to be non-work hours.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Exclusion settings
trans-unit.target: Exclusion settings

trans-unit.source: Open the **Microsoft Azure Backup agent** (you can find it by searching your machine for *Microsoft Azure Backup*).
trans-unit.target: Open the **Microsoft Azure Backup agent** (you can find it by searching your machine for *Microsoft Azure Backup*).

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure Backup agent click **Schedule Backup**.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure Backup agent click **Schedule Backup**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: In the Schedule Backup Wizard leave the **Make changes to backup items or times** option selected and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: In the Schedule Backup Wizard leave the **Make changes to backup items or times** option selected and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: Click **Exclusions Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Exclusions Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: Click **Add Exclusion**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add Exclusion**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: Select the location and then, click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Select the location and then, click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: Add the file extension in the **File Type** field.
trans-unit.target: Add the file extension in the **File Type** field.

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: Adding an .mp3 extension
trans-unit.target: Adding an .mp3 extension

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: To add another extension, click **Add Exclusion** and enter another file type extension (adding a .jpeg extension).
trans-unit.target: To add another extension, click **Add Exclusion** and enter another file type extension (adding a .jpeg extension).

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: When you've added all the extensions, click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: When you've added all the extensions, click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Continue through the Schedule Backup Wizard by clicking **Next** until the **Confirmation page**, then click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Continue through the Schedule Backup Wizard by clicking **Next** until the **Confirmation page**, then click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: Restore Windows Server or Windows Client from Azure
